intro: Maughania teysmanniana, commonly known as the Teyssmann's maughania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves that are typically lobed. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
